name: Odin
description: The chief god of Norse mythology, associated with wisdom, war, and magic.

name: Thor
description: The god of thunder, lightning, storms, oak trees, strength, and protection of mankind.

name: Frigg
description: The queen of Asgard and wife of Odin, associated with love, marriage, and destiny.

name: Baldur
description: The god of beauty, light, and purity, beloved by all except Loki.

name: Heimdall
description: The watchman of the gods, with keen senses and the horn Gjallarhorn.

name: Tyr
description: The god of war, bravery, and justice, known for sacrificing his hand to bind Fenrir.

name: Freyr
description: The god of fertility, prosperity, and sunshine, associated with peace and good harvests.

name: Idunn
description: The goddess of youth and keeper of the golden apples that grant immortality.

name: Bragi
description: The god of poetry and eloquence, known for his silver tongue and inspiration.

name: Vidar
description: The silent god of vengeance, destined to survive Ragnarök and avenge his father Odin.

name: Njord
description: The god of the sea, wind, and wealth, father of Freyr and Freyja.

name: Freyja
description: The goddess of love, beauty, fertility, and war, sister of Freyr.

name: Freyr
description: The god of fertility, prosperity, and sunshine, associated with peace and good harvests.

name: Ymir
description: The first giant in Norse mythology, created from the primordial frost.

name: Surtr
description: The fire giant who will set the world ablaze during Ragnarök.

name: Skadi
description: A giantess associated with skiing, winter, and hunting, daughter of Thjazi.

name: Thrym
description: The giant who stole Thor's hammer Mjölnir and demanded Freyja as his bride.

name: Utgard-Loki
description: The king of the giants of Utgard, known for his deceptive challenges to Thor and Loki.

name: Jormungandr
description: The Midgard Serpent, a giant sea serpent that encircles the earth.

name: Fenrir
description: A monstrous wolf, son of Loki, destined to kill Odin during Ragnarök.

name: Hel
description: The ruler of Helheim, the realm of the dead, daughter of Loki and Angrboda.

name: Nidhogg
description: The dragon who gnaws at the roots of Yggdrasil, symbolizing chaos and destruction.

name: Fafnir
description: A dwarf turned dragon after guarding a cursed treasure hoard, slain by Sigurd.

name: Gullinbursti
description: The golden boar created by the dwarves for Freyr, capable of shining light.

name: Sleipnir
description: Odin's eight-legged horse, born from Loki's transformation into a mare.

name: Fenris Wolf
description: The giant wolf bound by the gods until Ragnarok, when it will break free.

name: Huginn and Muninn
description: Odin's ravens of thought and memory, who fly over the world and bring him information.

name: Geri and Freki
description: Odin's wolves who accompany him and symbolize his warlike aspects.
